name: profusion
short_description: Python library implementing standard, counting, scalable, and memory-mapped Bloom filter data structures.
long_description: Profusion is a Python library that implements multiple variants of Bloom filters, probabilistic data structures optimized for space-efficient storage and querying of large datasets. The library provides four main implementations: a standard Bloom filter for basic membership testing, a counting Bloom filter for element frequency tracking, a scalable Bloom filter that dynamically grows as more elements are added, and a memory-mapped counting Bloom filter that uses file-backed storage for persistence. Bloom filters trade accuracy for space by using multiple hash functions to map elements to bit arrays, allowing for very fast lookups with a tunable false positive rate. These filters are commonly used in caching systems, spam detection, network routing, and other scenarios where space-efficient membership testing is valuable.

modules.description: Package initialization and exports for Bloom, CountingBloom, ScalableBloom, and MMCountingBloom classes.
Standard Bloom filter implementation with bit-level operations for membership testing, persistence via ZIP files, and configurable capacity and error ratios.
Counting Bloom filter that extends the standard Bloom filter to track element frequencies using binned counters instead of single bits.
Scalable Bloom filter that automatically adds new internal filters as element count exceeds capacity thresholds, supporting unlimited growth.
Memory-mapped counting Bloom filter using file-backed storage for persistence and concurrent access with file locking.
Unit tests for standard Bloom filter covering initialization, add/check operations, persistence, and saturation tracking.
Unit tests for counting Bloom filter validating frequency tracking, threshold checking, and persistence.
Unit tests for scalable Bloom filter verifying dynamic growth, multi-filter operations, and persistence.
Unit tests for memory-mapped counting Bloom filter testing file-backed storage and concurrent access patterns.
Package configuration defining metadata, dependencies, and installation requirements.
